lead_paragraph: BARUCH--Ralph M. The Board of Trustees and staff of Carnegie Hall mourn the passing of our dear friend and colleague Ralph M. Baruch. As the founder of Viacom and a pioneer in the cable television industry, Ralph created an enduring legacy that has profoundly influenced the entertainment field. Elected to the Carnegie Hall Board of Trustees in 1986, Ralph served the Hall in several leadership roles during his tenure, including vice chairman of the Board, chairman of the Nominating Committee, and member of the Executive Committee, before becoming an Honorary Trustee in 2007. Ralph was deeply passionate about music, and we are grateful for his personal generosity to Carnegie Hall as well as his dedicated advocacy on behalf of the arts. All of us at Carnegie Hall extend our heartfelt condolences to his wife Jean, to his daughters Alice, Eve, Michele, and Renee, and to the entire Baruch family. Sanford I. Weill, President; Mercedes T. Bass, Acting Chairman; Clive Gillinson, Executive & Artistic Director 1/3
